data.title: All About Avast Antivirus: History, Products & Services
data.meta_description: Avast is a well-known software company that offers top-notch antivirus. Learn about the company, its history, and popular products offered by the company.
data.text:
If you know more or less about antivirus software, then you must have come across the name Avast. It is a popular company that offers powerful software that can provide turtle-shell protection to desktop computers and mobile devices. But, if you want to get products or services from this company, then it would be best to get complete exposure to the company. Plus, learning about the quality of the products is an important factor. So, in the following article, you are going to get complete details about the Avast company’s overview, brief history, market status, and major features.

About Avast Company

Avast Software s.r.o is a multinational cyber security company that was formerly known as Alwil Software. In 1988, this company was established by Pavel Baudiš and Eduard Kučera. The headquarter of the company is located in Prague, Czech Republic. The company mainly produces and researches computer security software, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.

The company has more than 435 million monthly active users of the products and services of this company. As of April 2020, it is the second-largest anti-malware application vendor in the world. Moreover, the company has 25 offices around the world. Furthermore, the company has 1,700 employees, including all offices.

In 2021, NortonLifeLock, another famous American cybersecurity company, came in talks to merge with the Avast software company. In the same year, the Avast company’s director accepted a deal of US$8 billion. In addition, the company offers a plethora of outstanding products, but some of the most popular products are Avast Antivirus, Avast SecureLine VPN, and Avast Secure Browser.

A Brief History of the Company

The company came into existence in 1988, and the founders were Eduard Kučera and Pavel Baudiš. The two founders met at the Research Institute for Mathematical Machines in Czechoslovakia. The Communist Party of Czechoslovakia required them to participate in the communist party to study physics thats why they used math and computer at the institute. Pavel Baudiš installed the Vienna virus on a floppy disk and then found the first program to eliminate it.

Afterward, Pavel Baudiš asked Eduard Kučera to help him set up Avast. The company was founded as a cooperative, and initially, it was known as Alwil and had the product name Avast. In 1995, Ondřej Vlček, an Avast employee, developed the first program for Windows 95 OS. Virus Bulletin, an IT security testing organization,+ gave an award to Avast Software which resulted in an increase in the popularity of the product. However, in the late 1990s, the company was facing financial issues. However, the company declined McAfee's offer.

From 2000 to 2010

In 2001, when the Alwil company was struggling financially, the company introduced a free Avast software product. Therefore, the company's users grew to one million in 2004, and by 2006 the company had 20 million users. In 2009, Vince Steckler, a former Symantec executive, was appointed CEO of the company. The following year, the company adopted its own product name and changed its name to Avast. The company then raised $100 million in venture capital investment.

From 2010 to the Present

By the year 2013, the company had spread to 38 countries, and it had 200 million users. Moreover, the program was translated into 43 languages. During that time, there were about 360 employees in the Avast company. CVC Capital acquired the company's interest in 2014 and bought Avast at a valuation of one billion dollars. The company had the largest market cap for antivirus software as of 2015.

The company bought AVG in 2015 for $1.3 billion. In May 2018, the company IPO was on the London Stock Exchange and was valued at £2.4bn. At the time, it was one of the biggest technology listings in the UK. Jaya Balu became the company's Chief Information Security Officer in 2019. In 2020, the company had total assets of US$2.707 billion. As of now, Avast company has approximately 25 offices around the world and has 1,700 employees.

Most Popular Product Lines of Avast

The Avast company offers a range of popular product lines that meet the diverse security needs of individuals and businesses alike.

Avast Antivirus

It is the flagship product of Avast and provides complete protection from malware, viruses, ransomware, and other digital threats. With real-time scanning, intelligent threat detection, and advanced security features, Avast Antivirus is highly trusted by users around the world.

Avast Internet Security

This product offers advanced security features beyond antivirus protection. This has a strong firewall, secure browsing tools to prevent phishing attacks, and email scanning to detect malicious attachments or links.

Avast SecureLine VPN

Avast's VPN service ensures users' online privacy and security by encrypting their internet connections. It allows users to browse the web anonymously and securely access geo-restricted content.

Avast Cleanup

This utility software optimizes system performance by removing junk files, temporary files, and unnecessary applications. Plus, this helps free up disk space, increase speed, and improve overall system efficiency.

Avast Passwords

With the increasing number of online accounts, managing passwords becomes important. Avast Password provides a secure password management solution that stores and encrypts passwords, making it easy for users to log into their accounts across multiple devices.

Avast Business

Avast also provides robust cybersecurity solutions for businesses through its Avast Business product. It offers endpoint protection, network security, data protection, and other advanced features to protect organizations from online threats.

These products have gained popularity due to Avast's commitment to continuous innovation, user-friendly interfaces, and robust security features. Avast's reputation as a trusted cyber security provider and its dedication to user privacy has contributed to the widespread adoption of its products by millions of users globally.

How is Avast Company Doing in the Market?

Avast is a leading cybersecurity company that has established itself as a major player in the market. Also, with a broad range of products, such as antivirus software, Internet security solutions, and privacy tools, Avast meets the needs of individual and corporate customers. The company's market performance has been strong, driven by its strong product portfolio, global presence, and strategic partnerships.

The Avast company continues to innovate and adapt to emerging online threats while ensuring its relevance in a dynamic marketplace. Its commitment to user privacy and security has earned it a loyal customer base, which positions it well for future growth and success.

Conclusion
